timeline.author: npepinpe
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+apiVersion: v1
+kind: Secret
+metadata:
+  name: cloud-credentials
+type: Opaque
+stringData:
+  clientId: hH55UFivfw-bbHAuPwN545oyv8tTdW0z

replies.bodyText: Example ones; I already deleted the client 😉 Wanted to make the example as real as possible otherwise it is often confusing where to put and how the values.
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Can we add a comment on the README to make sure nobody actually commits real credentials 😅 ?
replies.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: Of course we can :D I think nobody does that, but even when it is just a small scope right :D
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: I'm thinking, maybe someone sees the example and thinks "oh it's safe to commit them I guess"? 🤷‍♂️ Maybe also a big comment in the default secret "NEVER COMMIT YOUR SECRETS" haha
replies.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: ah ok missed your comment :D should I add this comment to the default secret as well ?
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Hm, or can we .gitignore it? I think if the original is already committed then it won't be removed, but no further ones would be committed?
replies.author: npepinpe

timeline.message: chore(benchmark): add note for not pushing credentials

timeline.bodyText: Who is this document targeted at? I guess customers/community members don't have access to this region. So I guess this is targeted internally. I think it makes sense to make this more explicit.
timeline.author: pihme
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -71,3 +71,23 @@ In order to do this easily, just run:
 ```
 
 This will switch to the default namespace, delete the given namespace and delete the corresponding folder.
+
+## How to run a Benchmark in Camunda Cloud
+
+We currently waiting until https://github.com/camunda-cloud/enhancements/blob/master/CEP017-programmatic-access-to-console.md is implemented, until this is done we need to do some steps manually.
+
+### Setup Cloud Cluster
+
+ * Go to https://console.cloud.ultrawombat.com
+ * Login with your credentials, reach out to cloud team if you haven't one
+ * Create a new cluster, as region choose 'new chaos'. This means the cluster will be created in 'ultrachaos' gke cluster

replies.bodyText:
I can add something like this:
This targets only internal use cases and is not available for the outside.
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText: Yes, but maybe rephrase outside to external parties
replies.author: pihme

timeline.message: chore(benchmark): add notice that cloud benchmark are not avilable for extern
